title: Critical Facilitation Skills
description: A masterclass by Mark Collard

title: MISSION CRITICAL: An Intent-Based Leadership Simulation
description: Interactive leadership simulation focusing on intent-based leadership and decision-making under pressure.

title: Sport as a Medium for Social Justice
description: Can play be a pathway to justice? This immersive session invites participants to explore what justice means to them and how the energy and spirit of sport can inspire equity, inclusion, and collective empowerment.

title: A workshop with Sarabjit Singh Wallia
description: Experience-based workshop session led by Sarabjit Singh Wallia.

title: Designing Experiences That Stick: Tools for Connection, Reflection, and Growth
description: Practical tools to design engaging experiences that deepen connection, reflection, and growth for learners.

title: A social emotional learning workshop delivered through play!
description: This workshop is about exploring the opportunities of SEL in any story. Take any classroom subject like history or geography and add more colour to it with reflective SEL questions. Learn how to come up with simple questions that fall in the categories of the 5 pillars of SEL: self-awareness, self-management, relationship management, responsible decision-making, and social awareness.

title: The Art of Learning to Learn
description: This workshop, The Art of Learning to Learn, invites participants to explore how learning truly happens—within the mind, body, and experience of the learner. It is designed for educators, facilitators, coaches, and anyone curious about deepening their understanding of how humans make meaning, retain knowledge, and transform through awareness.

title: Beyond Psychological Safety: Integrating Somatics and the Polyvagal Lens in Experiential Facilitation
description: Beyond Psychological Safety explores how embodied awareness can transform learning spaces into containers of genuine safety and depth. This 3-hour experiential session invites facilitators, educators, and coaches to discover how the nervous system shapes engagement, reflection, and connection.

title: Setting the Benchmark: Quality Delivery & Price Standardisation in Experiential Education in India
description: The workshop aims to bring together key stakeholders to collaboratively define standards for delivery quality and pricing in the rapidly evolving experiential education sector.

title: Differentiated Pedagogies Through the Lens of Puppetry and Voice Modulation
description: Inclusive education thrives on inclusive tools. This session positions puppetry and voice modulation as powerful pedagogical strategies for differentiated learning.

title: Unboring History: Discovering the Stories Things Tell
description: In the age of AI, when facts are instantly accessible, memorizing historical data loses meaning. This session invites educators to move beyond content delivery toward cultivating historical thinking—the ability to look deeply, feel deeply, and think deeply.

title: Where Quiet Grows
description: Where Quiet Grows is an immersive, nature-based creative workshop designed to explore the intersection of art, ecology, and wellbeing. It invites participants to experience nature as collaborator, guide, and healer through multi-sensory engagement and creative expression.

title: Interactive Art, Theatre and Play as Experiential Pathways to Creating Safe Group Spaces for Sexuality Education
description: To make sexuality accessible, safe, contextual and experiential, this workshop uses Expressive Art Installations, Theatre of the Oppressed tools, Play for Peace games and Dance Movement Therapy practices.

title: Play as Resistance: Reclaiming Joy, Justice, and Connection
description: Play as Resistance is an experiential learning workshop that invites participants to explore how playful facilitation can restore compassion, foster social justice, and build meaningful human connections across divides.

title: Embodied Pedagogies: How Ritual and Belief Shape Learning Spaces
description: This 90-minute session invites participants into an exploration of how belief systems, rituals, and ancestral wisdom can reshape the way we understand and facilitate learning.

title: From Turbulence to Tranquility: Navigating Learning and Life with SEL
description: This workshop reimagines Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) as every child's entitlement—a compass that equips learners to face the future with confidence and courage.

title: Designing the Experience: The Art and Architecture of Transformative Learning
description: In experiential education, meaningful learning does not occur by chance, it is designed. This presentation explores Experience Design as the intentional architecture behind powerful experience-based training.

title: Let the learning happen - Do not teach!
description: Have you struggled to 'teach' a concept or topic to your audience? This session is about 'not to teach - Let them learn'! You will experience ways to make the learning process interesting and engaging.

title: The Synthetic Friend: When AI Listens but No One Else Does
description: The Synthetic Friend invites educators to explore a quiet emotional revolution happening in classrooms as students begin to replace real connection with artificial companionship.

title: Exploring The ObVerse - The other side of coin!
description: ObVerse is a deep dive into understanding - Why some of the Experiential Learning and Facilitation sessions land well while others don't.

title: The Discipline of Subtraction
description: When trying to create effective learning experiences, facilitators often make things too complicated. This session presents a simple design method: The Discipline of Subtraction.

title: Immersive Sound Meditation Session
description: A guided sound meditation to ground and reset through immersive auditory experience.

title: From Fibre to Freedom
description: From Fibre to Freedom is a hybrid workshop from the valleys of Ladakh that threads together the act of making and the act of understanding. Through the lens of spinning, the session invites participants to trace the journey of fibre from raw Pashmina and Yak wool.

title: A Workshop with Vinay Sirsi
description: Interactive workshop facilitated by Vinay Sirsi.

title: NLP for Experiential Educators
description: This workshop invites experiential learning practitioners to discover how Neuro-Linguistic Programming can serve as a multidimensional tool to deepen the impact of the experiences they already curate.

title: Seeing Experiential Education in classroom through a Montessori Lens
description: This experiential session invites educators and facilitators to step into the Montessori approach. The workshop offers an experiential session based on how to use Montessori principles to re-design and scaffold learning spaces.

title: Feel, Play, Grow
description: Step into a space where learning feels alive, where curiosity, play, and reflection meet. We explore how experiential methodology can help us build more connected classrooms and relationships.

title: Cultivating Well-being Through the Practice of Mandala of Systems Awareness
description: This workshop will explore the Mandala for Systems Awareness, a framework to help us reflect and understand the complexity and interconnectedness of life.

title: Atlas of Emotions – EMO Lab
description: In this 3-hour experiential session, we'll explore the Atlas of Emotions — a powerful framework to understand the rich landscape of our emotional experiences.

title: Forest of Stories: Exploring Identity through Storying and Re-storying
description: In Narrative Therapy, stories hold a significant value in a person's life. Through movement, nature and art-based activities, this workshop will explore the formation of stories of our lives.

title: SHAKTI Warriors- Warriors in Action
description: This interactive workshop introduces SHAKTI Warriors, a pioneering program that brings Social and Emotional Development (SED) to life through gamification, storytelling, and play.

title: The body knows your power: Embodied learning to nurture learners' agency
description: This 90-minute session invites participants to rediscover agency through their own bodies and relationships, using improvisational theatre and guided movement.

title: Experiential Education and Social Justice: Co-Creating Frameworks for Practice
description: This three-hour interactive workshop explores the intersections of experiential education and social justice, inviting educators into a space of reflection, dialogue, and co-creation.

title: Mindful Conflict Management: Building Collaborative Culture at the Workplace
description: In this workshop, participants will explore a chosen topic using Psychodrama and Sociodrama, experiential methods developed by Dr. J. L. Moreno.

title: Beyond the Binary: Reimagining Safety and Inclusion for Trans and Gender-Diverse People in Outdoor and Experiential Learning
description: Trans* and gender-diverse individuals often face barriers to inclusion. This workshop invites educators to reimagine what safety and belonging can mean.

title: Panels of Possibility: Learning Comic Writing as an EE Tool
description: Comics engage Head, Heart and Hand beautifully. Used judiciously, comics can be like colourful little superheroes - simplifying complex ideas and enabling powerful reflection.

title: What can Leaders learn from School Principals
description: The workshop will explore the critical role Program Leaders play in the success of a program unit. Participants will explore the three board frameworks (People, Program, Operations).

title: Embodied Listening': The Art of Receiving
description: In the 'Embodied Listening' workshop, we shall experience how the act and presence of deep listening actually feels like. A framework called 'Open Window Listening' will be introduced.

title: Connecting with the Self 2 through Self 1: Tapping into the unconscious through conscious triggers
description: In high pressure moments, how does one cut through the mind's chatter and perform to their best of abilities? In this session we put into application the theory of Self 1 and Self 2.

title: The Facilitator as Instrument: Exploring Embodied Presence in Experiential Learning
description: What if the real method is who we are while doing it? Embodied facilitation recognizes that our body, breath, and nervous system constantly communicate.

title: Contextual Sensitisers
description: Hands-on practice to design contextual sensitisers that align facilitation with participant realities and session goals.
